intro: Arnoseris minima, commonly known as the small arnoseris, is a flowering plant native to parts of southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. It features small, daisy-like flowers that are usually white or pale yellow in color. Arnoseris minima is often found in open vegetation and is considered a low-growing perennial species.
